p: As signal‐to‐noise (SNR) increases with magnetic field strength (B 0), ultrahigh field (UHF) 7 Tesla (T) should provide higher SNR, which is beneficial for the detection of low‐concentration n‐3 FA. The nominal spectral resolution in Hz between CH 3 and n‐3 CH 3 increases with the application of higher B 0; however, the resolution of the methyl triplets remains constant. For a better understanding of this effect, the estimated spectral dispersion in vivo is illustrated in Fig. 1 for three clinical field strengths of 1.5, 3, and 7 T.
